intro: Anacamptis picta, commonly known as the painted orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that range from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowering stems bear a single spike of showy, spurred flowers. Anacamptis picta is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
